101.title: Sutter Hired

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

101.plot: Head Coach Darryl Sutter takes over a struggling LA Kings squad and leads them into the playoffs as the 8-seed.

102.title: The Trade Deadline

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

102.plot: At the trade deadline, Dustin Brown's name is rumored while the LA Kings trade for scoring winger Jeff Carter and recall Slava Voynov to help their playoff push.

103.title: Brown Hits Sedin

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

103.plot: Dustin Brown sets the tone for the LA Kings playoff run making a statement with his hit on Henrik Sedin in the first round against Vancouver.

104.title: Stoll's OT Winner

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

104.plot: The first episode in a series of 20, watch Jarret Stoll's overtime goal to beat the Canucks and send the Kings to the second round of the 2012 playoffs.

105.title: Kopitar's Short-Handed Goal

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

105.plot: The Kings win their 9th straight road playoff game as Anze Kopitar scores an OT goal to give the Kings the victory in game 1 of the Stanley Cup Final.

106.title: Sweeping St. Louis

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

106.plot: The LA Kings continue their dominant 2012 playoff run by sweeping the St. Louis Blues in the second round.

107.title: Penner's OT Winner

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

107.plot: The second episode in a series of 20, watch Dustin Penner's overtime goal to beat the Coyotes and send the Kings to the Stanley Cup finals.

108.title: LAX Arrival

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

108.plot: Thousands of fans greet the LA Kings at LAX after winning the Western Conference Championship.

109.title: Kopitar's OT Winner

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

109.plot: The Kings win their 9th straight road playoff game as Anze Kopitar scores an OT goal to give the Kings the victory in game 1 of the Stanley Cup Final.

110.title: Carter's OT Winner

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

110.plot: The Kings take a commanding 2-0 lead over New Jersey in the Stanley Cup Final with this overtime goal by Jeff Carter.

111.title: Scuderi Gets Hit

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

111.plot: Watch the major boarding hit on Rob Scuderi during game 6 of the Stanley Cup Final that gave the Kings a 5 minute power play.

112.title: The 5-Minute Major

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

112.plot: The Kings receive a 5-minute major power play in game 6 of the Stanley Cup Final after an illegal hit by the New Jersey Devils on Rob Scuderi.

113.title: The Final Minutes

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

113.plot: Watch the final minutes of game 6 count down as the LA Kings win their first Stanley Cup in franchise history.

114.title: Quick's Conn Smythe

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

114.plot: Jonathan Quick backstops the LA Kings to a Stanley Cup title and earns the playoff MVP, the Conn Smythe Trophy.

115.title: The Stanley Cup

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

115.plot: Watch the LA Kings celebrate the moment they first lifted the most iconic trophy in sports, the Stanley Cup.

116.title: The Champagne Shower

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

116.plot: Experience the celebration behind the closed doors of the LA Kings locker room during the Champagne Shower.

117.title: The Championship Parade

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

117.plot: Join over a quarter million fans as the Kings celebrate their Stanley Cup championship with a parade through downtown LA.

118.title: The 16-4 Record

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

118.plot: The team reflects on their 16-4 playoff record that saw them not only start 11-1, but lead every series 3-0, an NHL first.

119.title: The Play-By-Play Calls

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

119.plot: Join Bob Miller and Nick Nickson in the booth to experience their championship play-by-play calls as the LA Kings win the Stanley Cup.

120.title: Looking Back

episode of.title: LA Kings: 2012 Stanley Cup Moments (TV Mini-Series 2013– )

120.plot: The team describes how the Stanley Cup will impact their careers and lives as they look back on the 2012 championship season.
